thread.title: Bengaluru FC to launch inter-school tournament
thread.title_full: Bengaluru FC to launch inter-school tournament - Bangalore Mirror

author: bangaloremirror.com
title: Bengaluru FC to launch inter-school tournament
text:
I-League club Bengaluru FC will conduct 'Schools Shield', an inter-school football tournament from Oct 7 to 16 at the Bangalore Football Stadium. The Schools Shield will be followed by 'Corporate Rumble', a championship for techies in the city, beginning from Oct 31, and 'College Face-off', an inter-collegiate tournament, in November.
The league-cum-knockout tournament will feature 23 schools. Competition will be spread over U-10, U-12 and U-14 categories. The U-10 matches will be a seven-a-side affair, with each half comprising 10 minutes. The U-12 games will be similarly held as a nine-a-side tournament, with one half lasting 15 minutes. There will be 11 players in each team in the U-14 category, played for 40 minutes.
Announcing the tournament, BFC chief technical officer, Mandar Tamhane, said: "We felt it was important to create competition at lower age groups and that's why we thought of starting from the U-10 category. There will be a rolling trophy involved for all the tournaments and individual awards for the best players."
BFC have tied up with Soccer Trac app to provide live scores and results of the matches.
